cyclone.name: BERYL
cyclone.current_location: about 780 miles ESE of the Lesser Antilles
cyclone.trajectory: Moving west-northwest toward the Lesser Antilles and expected to enter the eastern Caribbean Sea south of Puerto Rico early Tuesday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near Dominica / Martinique (southern Leeward-northern Windward Islands)

weather_observation.watch_coast: Hurricane Watch for Dominica; Tropical-Storm Watch for Barbados, St. Lucia, Martinique, Guadeloupe, St. Martin and St. Barthelemy
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Southern Leeward and northern Windward Islands Sunday–Monday; eastern Caribbean south of Puerto Rico Monday night–Tuesday
weather_observation.wind: Small chance (≤7%) of sustained 34-kt (39-mph) winds late Monday night into Tuesday; most likely outcome is breezy conditions well below gale force.
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected for San Juan given the forecast track well south of the island.
weather_observation.rainfall: Outer rainbands could bring brief squalls with 1–2 inches of rain, but widespread heavy rainfall is not anticipated.
